context.description: The Regular Expression Generator helps you to create a regular expression from examples.
The Regular Expression Builder helps you to build a regular expression rule by selecting constructs and combining them.
Pattern discovery exposes patterns in the data to help you to develop new AQL rules.
The Export Extractor helps you to export Text Analytics Module (.tam) file from the text analytics tooling environment to the local file system.
The Import Extractor imports Text Analytics modules from the BigInsights Information Extraction Web Tooling server into BigInsights Tools for Eclipse.
The Run Configuration dialog helps you to create launch configurations to run an AQL file against a given input collection.

topic.label: External Tables and External Dictionaries tabs in Text Analytics run configuration

context.description: The Profile Configurations dialog helps you to create launch configurations to profile a text analytics application.

topic.label: Creating and executing a profile configuration

context.description: The New AQL script dialog allows you to create a new AQL file for text analytics.
The New AQL Module dialog allows you to create a new AQL module for text analytics.
The configure dialog helps you to setup preferences for the chosen labeled document collection
This window helps you to import a dataset into a labeled document collection.
This window helps you to import an extraction result into a labeled document collection.
The Export Results dialog helps you to export results to the local file system.

Annotation Query Language (AQL) is a language for building extractors that extract structured information from unstructured or semistructured text. The AQL Editor provides a framework to develop and test AQL files.
Use the Annotation Explorer to view the results of an extractor run. All spans across all documents are displayed.
For a selected input document, use the Result Tree View to view all of the output views and their attributes in a tree format.
Use the Result Table View to view the tuples of an output view in a table.
Use the Collection Differences View to compare different extractor results.

topic.label: Comparing the results of one extractor run to the results of another run

context.description: Use the Expanded Pattern Context View to display the contexts that support the smaller patterns in the Pattern Context View.

The Extraction Plan helps you organize examples, clues, and rules (basic feature, candidate generation, filter and consolidation) when you develop an extractor using the Text Analytics Workflow Perspective.
The Extraction Tasks are the six development tasks that you perform when you develop an extractor. You can find examples of these tasks in the tutorial for the Text Analytics Workflow Perspective.
Use the File Differences Summary to view a summary of the annotation differences between the result and reference file.

topic.label: Evaluating quality by combining the labeled document collection with the Annotation Difference Viewer
Comparing the results of one extractor run to the results of another run

context.description: Use the File Side-by-Side Differences view to view the result file and the reference file side by side.

topic.label: Evaluating quality by combining the labeled document collection with the Annotation Difference Viewer
Comparing the results of one extractor run to the results of another run

context.description: Use the Pattern Context View to display the smaller patterns that are associated with a common pattern (bubble) in the Pattern Discovery Viewer.
Use the Pattern Discovery View to display results from discovered patterns in the input text. Each bubble represents a common pattern.
Use the Profiler View to troubleshoot performance problems in the AQL code.

Understanding the lineage (or provenance) of the results of an extractor -- the output tuple generated by the extractor -- is helpful for debugging extractors that contain a large number of AQL statements with complex interdependencies. Use the Provenance View to view the lineage of analysis results.

topic.label: Viewing the lineage of analysis results

context.description: Use the Rules History View to show the history of how certain patterns have been merged into a single pattern (bubble) by the pattern discovery algorithm.
Based on what is selected in the Result Tree View, use the Text Analytics Result Editor to show the highlighted annotations.
Dictionaries are words or phrases that extractors use to match text. Use the Dictionary Editor to create and edit external dictionary files.
Use the Tagging Editor to select text snippets that can serve as examples of what you want to extract and to define other labels to use as clues for extraction.

topic.label: Creating or modifying an extractor by using the Text Analytics Workflow Perspective

context.description: A labeled document collection is the standard way to evaluate the accuracy and completeness of an extractor. Use the Labeled Document Collection Viewer to label the text in the document collection.

topic.label: Comparing the results of one extractor run to the results of another run
Evaluating quality by combining the labeled document collection with the Annotation Difference Viewer

context.description: Use the Text Analytics Preferences page to specify preferences for your development and execution environment.
The Text Analytics system extracts information from unstructured and semistructured data. Use the Text Analytics Properties page to specify the properties for your project.
This view shows a tree structure with a selected AQL view as the root and its children as other AQL views on which the root is dependent.
This view shows a tree structure with a selected AQL view as the root and its children as other AQL views that require the root in their definitions.
This view shows the meta data of the module and the compiled form of the extractor
